Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Overnight \O"ver*night`\, n. The fore part of the night last past; the previous evening. [R.] --Shak. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
overnight \o"ver*night"\, adv. 1. In the fore part of the night last past; in the evening before. [1913 Webster]
2. Throughout the night; as, the candle will not last overnight. [1913 Webster]
3. During the night; hence, in a short period of time; as, his prospects of winning changed overnight. [PJC]
I had been telling her all that happened overnight. --Dickens. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: overnight \o"ver*night"\, a. Ocurring or accomplished during one night; as, guaranteed overnight delivery of a package. [PJC]

overnight adj : lasting through or extending over the whole night; "a nightlong vigil"; "an overnight trip" [syn: {nightlong}] adv : happening in a short time or with great speed; "these solutions cannot be found overnight!"
